Usage¶

Installation¶

To use MTE code, clone from github.
Make sure to have python3 and gnuplot installed and updated.

General outline (hierarchy) of code¶

The main body of code is called MTE.py, here one can change model setup for different benchmarks, modify meshing, etc. It calls upon two modules composed of various functions:

  1. The computational module magnetostatics.py, containing mostly translation of original Fortran77 code from [Bla95].
  2. The visualization module tools.py, containing functions to produce vtu files.

Furthermore, two other (optional) modules are available only for the Mount Etna case study, where the field sites of [MdG23] are reproduced:

  1. set_measurement_parameters import.py, which contains one function (see Functions) that returns DEM, site and path specific values like pathfile, number of points, IGRF, and more, see Functions, from input.
  2. etna.py, where one defines the input parameters, see Case study: Mount Etna, to run different options to reproduce field paths, and calling set_measurement_parameters import.py

Lastly, there are two scripts that automatically modify etna.py, script_etna_full.sh, and script_etna.sh, see Case study: Mount Etna for more information.

Please see each respective section for specific usage of the code: Benchmarks, Synthetic topopography: flank simulations, Parameters and Case study: Mount Etna.
